Metadata.Author: Orion Lawlor <lawlor@alaska.edu>
Metadata.Purpose: Anchor all Mars orbital infrastructure in a common inertial reference frame.
Metadata.Coordinates: Origin is in the exact center of the planet; Z axis runs through north pole; X axis points toward Mars' vernal equinox.  The planet's surface rotates beneath this volume (this is a non-rotating inertial frame of reference).
Metadata.Sources: Orbital elements for the moons are missing the arguments of perigee.  Other numbers are from https://nssdc.gsfc.nasa.gov/planetary/factsheet/marsfact.html

Volume.Purpose: Orbital traffic control for Mars sphere of influence.
